newsitem.title: USA: Summit sees Q4 shr loss before charge.
newsitem.headline: Summit sees Q4 shr loss before charge.

text.p: Summit Medical Systems Inc expects to report a fourth quarter 1996 loss of between $0.07 and $0.09 per share before a non-recurring charge, the firm said in a statement released on Friday.
The firm also said it sees fourth quarter revenues at about $4 million.

The company expects to record non-recurring charges of between $8 and $9 million in the fourth quarter for in-process research and development costs for the buyout of the Cordillera LLC joint venture, and for the acquisition of C.L. McIntosh & Associates Inc.
Summit established a joint venture at Duke University in December 1995 to commercialize a cardiology patient information and monitoring system called Crescendo.
